scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You decide to take a quick look at the task. While discussing the issue, [Monica] and [Bob] join the conversation.
scenes.description: 'Thanks for looking into this. I'm sure we can get it done quickly. But Bob and I are swamped with other tasks too. Can we split the work evenly?' She frowns slightly, typing quickly.

options.text: I can help you for a short time, but I’ll need to hand it off to someone else after that.
options.analysis: You choose a middle ground, showing good social skills and emotional balance. However, motivation and self-regulation could be higher.

options.text: I’m really trying to keep my leave time sacred. Can we split the work evenly?
options.analysis: You prioritize your own well-being and suggest a fair distribution of work, showing good emotional perception and empathy, though social skills could be better.

options.text: I’ll do what I can, but I might need you both to help with some parts.
options.analysis: You agree to help while expressing the need for some assistance, showing good emotional control and motivation, but empathy could be improved.
